title: Southern Punjab beat Sindh in fourth round of Quaid-e-Azam Trophy
text:
Bilawal Bhatti and Aamir Yamin shared seven wickets in the second inning to help Southern Punjab to beat Sindh by an inning and 129 runs in the fourth round of the Quaid-e-Azam Trophy.

Resuming on 58-3, Sindh were bowled out for 133 runs with Bhatti and Yamin destroying their batting line. Bhatti took four wickets while Yamin bagged three wickets after scoring a fighting century on day three at UBL Sports Complex.

Omair Bin Yousuf scored 37 runs while Saad Ali managed to score 30 runs for Sindh but couldn’t manage to lead the charge after Sindh suffered a follow-on in the first inning.

On the other hand, at the KRL Stadium Rawalpindi, the match between Baluchistan and Northern ended in a draw.

Baluchistan batsmen somehow managed to survive on day four as they finished for 183-7.
